intro: Solanum melaniferum, commonly known as the black nightshade, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant produces small, dark purple to black berries that are toxic to humans and animals. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, with five petals and a distinctive yellow center. The species belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae), which includes other familiar plants like tomatoes and potatoes.
